attributes.description: The electronics company Apple' supply chain will be broken down, specifically focusing on their iPhone production.
attributes.title: Apple
Raw Materials - Tantalum
attributes.description: One of the major raw materials of an iPhone (used for connectors and the internals of the phone) is most commonly found in Australia.

attributes.title: Raw Materials - Tungsten
attributes.description: Although Tungsten is considered a conflict material (due to the mining procedures in the Democratic Republic of Congo), most of the world's Tungsten production occurs in Myanmar.

attributes.title: iPhone assembly - Hon Hai Precision Industries
attributes.description: iPhones are specifically assembled by Hon Hai Precision Industries. A majority of this production occurs in China, however Hon Hai also has an office in Vietnam, as well as USA.

attributes.title: Raw Materials - TIn
attributes.description: Tin is mainly found in areas such as Malaysia, as well as Thailand and Bolivia.

attributes.title: iPhone Assembly - Vietnam
attributes.address: Bac Giang, Bac Giang province, Vietnam
attributes.description: Hon Hai Precision Industries has most of it's factories in China, however there is one specific plant in VIetnam.

attributes.title: iPhone Assembly - California
attributes.description: Hon Hai Precision Industries has one factory in America, used for either assembly or relations between it's contractor, Apple.

attributes.title: Apple Distribution Warehouse - Canada
Apple Distribution Centre - USA
attributes.description: Major Distribution Centre for Apple in the United States.

attributes.title: Apple Distribution Centre - Europe
